intro: Ludwigia swartziana, commonly known as the red Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in aquatic or wetland environments, often as a floating or submerged species. Its leaves are usually ovate or lanceolate, and they can vary in color from green to reddish. Ludwigia swartziana is popular in aquariums and water gardens due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
